title: Arsene Wenger told by Arsenal board to make decision on Gunners future during international break
text:
Arsene Wenger told by Arsenal board to make decision on Gunners future during international break The Gunners face Manchester City on April 2 in their first game back after the break Share Wenger has been told to make a decision by the start of April (Photo: REUTERS) Share Get Arsenal FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Arsenal’s under-fire board have told Arsene Wenger to make a decision on his future during the international break. 
They want finality on a ­situation that is tearing apart the club by the time the ­Gunners face Manchester City at the Emirates on April 2. 
Arsenal travel to West Brom on Saturday giving Wenger a fortnight to ponder whether to sign a new two-year contract. 
The Frenchman has been saying publicly that he won’t decide on his future until the end of the season while last week chairman Sir Chips Keswick insisted that the club would not rush Wenger into a decision. Wenger's men beat Lincoln 5-0 to reach the FA Cup semi-finals (Photo: AFP) Read More Arsene Wenger dodges bullet as Arsenal run riot over Lincoln 
But behind the scenes there is a growing determination to bring closure on ‘will he stay or will he go’. After yesterday’s 5-0 win over Lincoln, Wenger said: “Let’s not talk about me, we’ve done it far too much over the last few weeks. 
“We have disappointed our fans recently. We want to go again to Wembley to win. 
“We had a big disappointment in the Champions League. After that we have to respond and we needed players solid mentally. 
“I have shown in my life that I try to serve this club with total commitment and I will do that as long as I am here. How long? I don’t know. I have shown a lot of loyalty and my preference is here. I focus on my job and let others judge my performances.” Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
